lines.text:
[to Biff]
Why, if you weren't deductible, I'd disown you!
Remember, you're in Washington. Stop trying to be reasonable about money or you're going to bollocks up the whole thing.
Don't let those double-breasted suits up there fool you. Those boys are tough.
Now if you'll just give me a check for the amount on this paper here, please.
But how can I pay you if nobody pays me?

Well, I regret to say, Professor, that's your problem. But look at it from our standpoint. We've been counting on you. We trusted you. Uncle Sam needs the money. You don't build those rockets to the moon with Green Stamps, you know.
You'd think those people at the Pentagon could've least have given us a couple hundred thousand out of petty cash, or something.
forward. And the fellow who makes the most mistakes may be the one who will save the neck of the whole world some day.

Your tax bill for the first three Quarters of the current year. The figure includes delinquent penalties of $12,895 at 5% for the first two Quarters. All based on an estimate of projected earnings, of course.

Oh, you'll be recompensed. Goodness knows the Armed Services are never chintzy. Now what we do, we beard the Appropriations boys in Congress. Matter of fact, I'm putting two of my bravest financial officers on the mission.

[to Shelby Ashton]
I'm terribly sorry, Professor, but did our brand-new patrol car get in your way?
Officer, it wasn't my fault! It's that fiend, Brainard! He's out there somewhere! Get him! Find him! Do something!
If need be, I'll bet you'd put your own mother in jail.
Funny you should mention that about Mom. A little matter of some unreported income from jams and jellies. We nailed her dead to rights!
I knew you were vague, lover, but I didn't think you were that vague.

[about his father, Alonzo Hawk]
Pop's the biggest loan shark in the state, and he's proud of it.
Let's just say your father is a very shrewd businessman.
Shrewd? The only time my pop ever got the worst of a bargain was when he got me. I just didn't turn out the way he wanted me to at all.
I hardly consider myself in the same class as Mr. Edison.

Professor, I don't think you realize how important this discovery of yours is. It's big. We've got to handle it big, everything about it. If you settle chickenfeed now, it's going to be a chickenfeed operation. Everyone is going to lose face. Everything is going to fall apart, all the way down the line. And the free world loses another battle. Is that what you want?
Well, no, I wouldn't that, sir.

[speaking to Daggett about his meeting at Washington]
Things aren't quite as simple as I hoped they'd be.
So they gave you the ol' dipsy-do, huh? They really sandbagged you. They hung your hide up on the barn door to dry.
Professor, am I to assume something has gone amiss?
Well...
But I thought they were delighted with your discovery.
Oh, they are. It's just... Well, it's a little hard to explain.
May I?
[walks up to Brainard and Daggett]
Allow me to boil it down for you gentlemen, and you'll be sure if I get it straight?
[to Brainard]
the boys in Washington latched onto your little discovery so you can't sell it anywhere else.
[Brainard nods slowly]
meantime, you've got no money. How am I doing?
[Brainard nods again]

03, a fleet of bulldozers owned by the Auld Lang Syne Demolition and Wrecking Company will start rolling through those hallowed gates and start flattening these ivy-covered walls in all directions. Period! End of story! Very sad. But, uh, personally, I'm crazy about it.
[chuckles]
I can't believe you'd do a thing like that, Mr. Hawk.
Oh, you can't?
No.
Well, boys, it looks like I'm calling the tune again. Anybody care to dance?

[Trailing Shelby Ashton's car on his flying Model T car]
Okay, Charlie! Battle Stations! I need a guinea pig for this experiment, and I know just the 'pig'!
Tiny Medford has turned a rout into a battle of the Titans!
